column2: Edith's nurse dressed her in a fresh
column4: and Edith dressed her dolly in her best dress
column5: and went out under the trees where her nurse had set the table for two. And then she sat in a chair at the table and waited. But the big town clock struck four and no Helen came; and then she waited for half an hour longer. Then Edith put her dolly down on the chair and went in the house to find her mother."Mama
column6: she said, I think Helen is very rude
column7: she doesn't come to my party and I invited her!""Just wait a little longer
column9: said her mother, and she will come. Maybe her nurse was busy dressing Helen's little sister and brother and couldn't get her ready in time.""But I invited her
column10: was all Edith could say; but I invited her
